abstract: Competitive pace of New York City's dating scene is heightened by matchmaking apps like Tinder, bringing addictive and frenetic style of flirting to a dating culture already viewed as abrupt and aggressive; creators say there are about one million users in New York, the largest market in the country; chief aspect of Tinder's popularity is fact that app lets users limit search for romance right in their own neighborhood.
lead_paragraph: The dating app Tinder has not fundamentally changed the local dating scene so much as quickened and coarsened its already abrupt, aggressive nature.

headline.main: On Tinder, Taking a Swipe at Love, or Sex, or Something, in New York
headline.print_headline: Taking a Swipe at Love (or Something)

snippet: The dating app Tinder has not fundamentally changed the local dating scene so much as quickened and coarsened its already abrupt, aggressive nature.
